title: Computer Shopper - August 2015 (gnv64)
description:
Computer Shopper - August 2015
English | PDF | 148 pages | 43.9 mb

Regulars
6 Letters
10 Under Development - A nasty financial shock for David Robinson this month, as he finds some cyber-urchin
has been fiddling with his account
12 Cybercop - There's more cybercrime about than you may think, but at least the powers that be are doing something, says Gordon Holmes
14 Rants & Raves - Shopper is throwing its clogs in the loom this month, as it decides books are better than Google and fitness tracking's for mugs
146 Zygote - Voter fraud makes the land of the free look like the home of the cyber-iUiterate. Better to follow Australia's example and fight antisocial behaviour with Barry Manilow

Learn
130 Use Continuity with iOS 8 - We explain how to make and receive phone calls on all your iOS 8 devices
132 Business Help - Our resident expert answers those persistent software queries
134 Helpfile - Step this way for all your hardware and Windows problems
136 Advanced Projects - Dropbox is already a great way to keep your files in sync, but there are several free ways to make it even more powerful and flexible, Clive Webster shows you how
139 Multimedia Expert - Ben Pitt shows you the magic of convolution effects, which apply the acoustics of real spaces to your sound recordings
143 App Creative - You don't need a fancy camera to make amazing light paintings. Incredible effects are possible with your tablet or smartphone, as Ben Pitt explains

Features
96 Virtually real - Thanks to new tech such as Microsoft's HoloLens augmented-reality headset, the digital world has never been closer to the physical. Nicole Kobie gazes into the future
102 OS explained - It's at the heart of everything you do with your pc, but how does the operating system work? Mike Bedford takes a look under the bonnet
108 Music to your ears - Established names Spotify and Napster are up against upstarts such as Tidal in the battle for your listening attention. We find out which music-streaming service is the one for you
115 Take control of your email - An email address on your own domain gives you more control over your account. We show you the benefits of leaving Gmail behind
118 A Bing in the tail - Unofficial download sites advertised on Bing can infect your PC with malware. We use our sacrificial laptop to see how bad the problem is
121 Charge faster - We investigate why modern laptops and phones can take an age to charge, and show you how to speed things up
124 Save Ã‚Â£Ã‚Â£Ã‚Â£s on your phone contract - Buying a phone with a contract isn't always the cheapest way. We show you how to get the phone you want at the right price

Group Test
78 Tablets - From the latest jPads to Microsoft's new Surface and all the best Android models, there's a tablet for you in this month's group test. And with prices as low as Ã‚Â£80, there's a slate here for everyone
